newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb on dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb on dollar demand.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.03 down at 41.35 to the dollar in the kerb market on Monday as demand for the dollar remained higher than its supply, dealers said.
"The rupee slipped as dollar demand was higher than supply," one dealer said. "Speculators are buying dollars as the current levels are attractive."

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, fixed on July 11, was at 40.5200/40.7226 rupees to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates ended unchanged at 2.0 percent. -- Amir Zia (9221) 5685192; Fax 5673428
